data.meta_description: Siteground vs namehero SiteGround's once-stellar reputation has faded with rising costs and declining service, while NameHero gains trust with affordable, reliable hosting.

Table of Contents

Toggle

When it comes to choosing the right web hosting provider, the SiteGround vs NameHero debate is a critical one for many website owners. In the ongoing SiteGround vs NameHero comparison, NameHero clearly emerges as the superior choice. While SiteGround has its strengths, NameHero surpasses it with outstanding performance, exceptional customer support, and more competitive pricing. This blog post will explore Some of the basic and essential features a Web hosting should have in the SiteGround vs NameHero contest. From faster load times to advanced features, NameHero offers significant advantages that make it the preferred option in the SiteGround vs NameHero matchup. Join us as we dive into the reasons why NameHero is the clear winner in this important comparison.

I personally hosted my niche sites on both Web Hosting platform for a few month and analyze both Hosting providers perdomance to tell you real world experience

Siteground vs Namehero – My verdict

Well, there were days when Siteground was considered one of the biggest and most reliable hosting providers, but now days they seem to have lost their prestige. Even though their service has become worse, Namehero continues to earn customers trust and become a reliable web hosting provider at affordable pricing, unlike Siteground’s renewed skyrocketing pricing hike.

Pricing: NameHero’s entry-level plan starts at $2.86 per month, whereas SiteGround’s starts at $4.99 per month.

Performance: NameHero boasts better server response time and Global TTFB compared to SiteGround.

Server Locations: NameHero offers hosting from 2 server locations, while SiteGround provides access to 6, offering more options for server selection.

Additional Features: Both NameHero and SiteGround include free Cloudflare CDN and automated daily backups with their hosting plans.

Staging: SiteGround offers the Staging feature even on the Startup plan, whereas NameHero includes it on all plans.

Security & Support: Both hosting providers offer reliable security measures and 24/7 support for their customers.

Winner –

Why You Should Choose NameHero Over SiteGround

Cost Efficiency: NameHero offers significantly lower monthly rates compared to SiteGround, making it a more budget-friendly option for web hosting.

Free Domain Registration: NameHero includes a free domain registration with its hosting plans, which can save you additional expenses compared to SiteGround, where the domain is not included in the base price.

Value for Money: With lower initial costs and added benefits like a free domain, NameHero provides excellent value for money, especially for new website owners or small businesses.

Competitive Renewal Rates: NameHero’s renewal rates are often more competitive than SiteGround’s, which helps keep long-term hosting costs manageable.

Why You Should Choose SiteGround Over NameHero

Advanced Performance Features: SiteGround is known for its robust performance features, including enhanced speed and reliability with its proprietary caching solutions and advanced infrastructure.

Comprehensive Support: SiteGround offers exceptional customer support, including 24/7 live chat and phone support, known for being highly responsive and helpful.

User-Friendly Interface: SiteGround provides a more intuitive and user-friendly control panel, which can simplify the management of your hosting environment.

Strong Reputation: SiteGround has a long-standing reputation for quality and stability in the hosting industry, which can offer peace of mind regarding the reliability of your website hosting.

NameHero Vs. SiteGround: Performance

NameHero Performance:

Quickest Loading Time: 1.6 seconds (PageSpeed Insights)

Slowest Loading Time: 1.8 seconds (PageSpeed Insights)

Uptime: 99.9%

SiteGround Performance:

Empty Site Loading Time (US Server): 0.3 seconds (GTmetrix)

Loaded WordPress Site (US Server): 0.8 seconds (LCP after adding heavy content)

London Server Loading Time: 481 ms (0.481 seconds)

Mumbai Server Loading Time: 0.9 seconds

Comparison with Hostinger: Faster than Hostinger in the US (SiteGround: 0.3s vs. Hostinger: 479ms), London (SiteGround: 481ms vs. Hostinger: 1.3s), and Mumbai (SiteGround: 0.9s vs. Hostinger: 1.7s).

Summary:

Speed: SiteGround outperforms NameHero in speed, with the fastest loading time at 0.3 seconds compared to NameHero’s 1.6 seconds. Even with a more complex WordPress installation, SiteGround maintains a fast loading time of 0.8 seconds, whereas NameHero’s quickest is 1.6 seconds.

Geographical Performance: SiteGround shows consistent performance across different locations, with results in London and Mumbai still under 1 second, which is impressive. NameHero’s performance doesn’t show such detailed location-based testing, but its overall speed is slower.

Uptime: NameHero has a slightly better uptime guarantee of 99.9%.

Overall, SiteGround is superior in terms of speed, especially when considering geographical performance and handling more complex websites.

Server Response Time:

NameHero excels in US regions with low SRTs of 24 ms (East) and 76 ms (West), ensuring quick access and minimal latency for North American users. However, the absence of data centers in Asia results in higher SRTs, such as 270 ms in Mumbai.

Speed Test Results:

NameHero performs well in locations like New York with 733.67 ms response times, leveraging technologies like Litespeed cache for optimized performance. Yet, speeds in Bangalore are slower at 4.72 seconds, indicating a need for improved global content delivery strategies.

Uptime Reliability:

SiteGround emerges as a leader with an impressive uptime guarantee and actual performance of 99.99%, significantly reducing downtime to a minimal 52 minutes per year. This reliability ensures consistent availability and minimal disruption for users globally.

Choosing the Right Provider

For US-Centric Users: NameHero offers excellent server response times and speed test results, ideal for users primarily located in North America.

For Global Reach and Reliability: SiteGround’s unparalleled uptime performance makes it a reliable choice for users requiring consistent availability and minimal downtime, regardless of geographical location.

When considering between NameHero and SiteGround, prioritize based on your specific needs for speed, global reach, and uptime reliability. NameHero excels in local speed and performance optimizations, while SiteGround guarantees exceptional uptime for global accessibility and reliability.

Load Testing

For websites expecting high traffic and potential spikes, a robust architecture is essential for uninterrupted operation. To assess this, I conducted load testing on both my NameHero and SiteGround sites.

In the load testing, NameHero achieved 48 ms for Clients Per Test (1000 Clients in 1 Minute) and 59 ms for Maintain Client Load (500 Clients in 1 Minute). Meanwhile, SiteGround scored 45 ms for Clients Per Test and 201 ms for Maintain Client Load under similar conditions.

From these results, it’s evident that NameHero exhibits superior load handling capacity compared to SiteGround.

Global TTFB

Assessing the Global TTFB (Time To First Byte) is crucial to evaluate a service’s performance across diverse global locations, particularly for sites reliant on global traffic. Recently, I conducted a Global TTFB test on my demo sites across ten global locations.

For my NameHero site, the average TTFB stood at 433.24 ms, showcasing consistent performance across various global locations. Notably, the lowest TTFB was recorded in New York at 100.57 ms, while the highest TTFB occurred in Bangalore at 721.32 ms.

In contrast, my SiteGround site displayed an average TTFB of 861.03 ms, with notable variations across global locations. Surprisingly, TTFB exceeded 1 second in four locations. The lowest TTFB was observed in New York at 287.97 ms, whereas the highest TTFB was recorded in Frankfurt, exceeding 1.66 seconds. Consequently, SiteGround’s Global TTFB performance fell short, highlighting NameHero’s consistent and impressive TTFB across all global locations.

Core Web Vitals

Examining the Core Web Vitals of both services is crucial in determining the support they offer to websites in delivering optimal user experiences.

In recent tests, my NameHero site displayed a ‘Largest Contentful Paint’ of 0.653s, ‘Total Blocking Time’ of 0.000s, and ‘Cumulative Layout Shift’ of 0. Conversely, my SiteGround site showed a ‘Largest Contentful Paint’ of 0.876s, ‘Total Blocking Time’ of 0.006s, and ‘Cumulative Layout Shift’ of 0.

Based on these results, it’s evident that NameHero outperforms SiteGround in terms of Core Web Vitals, indicating better support for enhancing user experiences.

Winner –

Comparison Summary:

Price:

NameHero: Offers deeper discounts, making it more affordable initially, especially with their Starter and Turbo WordPress plans.

SiteGround: Slightly higher pricing even at the discounted rate, but offers competitive pricing with more resources in their higher-tier plans.

Features:

NameHero: Provides more RAM and unlimited NVMe storage even in the lower-tier plans, with additional features like free LiteSpeed Caching, daily backups, and auto WordPress updates. The free domain offer on Turbo plans adds significant value.

SiteGround: Includes SSD storage, free SSL, CDN, and a free domain for the first year across all plans. The performance is solid, especially for those needing reliable hosting with fewer features than NameHero.

Target Audience:

NameHero: Ideal for users seeking advanced features and performance at a lower cost, particularly beneficial for WordPress users.

SiteGround: Better suited for those prioritizing a well-established provider with consistent performance, even if it comes at a higher price.

Conclusion:

If you’re focused on cost savings and feature-rich hosting, NameHero is the more economical choice, especially with its heavy discounts and additional perks like unlimited NVMe storage and free domains. SiteGround remains a strong contender for those willing to invest a bit more for a slightly more premium service, particularly with their SSD storage and global CDN network.

Winner –

Namehero vs Siteground: Backup feature

NameHero’s “Starter Cloud” plan offers superior backup features compared to SiteGround’s StartUp plan. NameHero allows all users to take snapshots of their entire website on demand, while SiteGround limits this functionality to their GrowBig and GoGeek plans.

Recently, Ryan Gray, CEO of NameHero, upgraded their backup system with JetBackup, making the process automatic. This improvement, coupled with offsite backups, enhances NameHero’s backup capabilities. However, unlike SiteGround, NameHero only offers daily and weekly restore options, while SiteGround provides access to the last 30 daily backups on higher-tier plans.

Offsite Backup Advantage:

An outstanding benefit of NameHero is that their backups are stored offsite, offering an extra layer of security. Although not explicitly mentioned on their website, CEO Ryan Gray confirmed that backups are maintained on a separate network in a different data center, reducing the risk of data loss. SiteGround also offers offsite backups by default, eliminating the need for their separate service, VaultPress.

NameHero’s Partnership with DropMySite:

NameHero’s collaboration with DropMySite provides users with affordable backup services from a third party if needed. This partnership offers an alternative to CodeGuard and Jetpack. Compared to SiteGround’s VaultPress integration, DropMySite is considered more cost-effective.

Backup Ratings:

– NameHero: ★★★★☆ (4/5)

– SiteGround: ★★★★★ (5/5)

SiteGround holds a slight advantage due to its 30-day automatic backup retention, while NameHero offers 7-day backups. Additionally, SiteGround now stores its backups offsite, (Now Namehero gives you free daily backup)

Winner –

NameHero vs SiteGround – Security Features

NameHero Security Features:

Two Factor Authentication (2FA):

Enhance account security with Two Factor Authentication, requiring time-based codes from authenticator apps during login.

Free SSL Certificates:

Protect all domains and sub-domains with free SSL certificates, ensuring secure data transmission.

ModSecurity:

Web application firewall optimized for CMS platforms like WordPress and Magento, blocking unauthorized login attempts and enhancing security.

Hotlink Protection:

Prevent unauthorized bandwidth usage by blocking direct linking to your website’s resources.

IP Blocker:

Restrict specific IP addresses from accessing your website, adding an additional layer of access control.

SSH Access:

Secure remote access to server for advanced configurations and management.

Imunify360:

Comprehensive firewall and malware scanner protecting hosting servers from brute force attacks, DDoS attacks, and more.

SiteGround Security Features:

Security Optimizer Plugin:

Offers security options like hiding WordPress version, two-step verification, and post-hack actions for recovery and prevention.

Comparison:

Two Factor Authentication (2FA): Both NameHero and SiteGround offer 2FA, ensuring secure login procedures. However, NameHero’s integration with various authenticator apps like Google Authenticator or Duo provides flexibility and reliability.

SSL Certificates: NameHero includes free SSL certificates for all domains and sub-domains, whereas SiteGround also provides SSL but with additional focus on proprietary security plugins rather than emphasizing widespread free SSL availability.

Firewall and Malware Protection: While SiteGround offers a dedicated Security Optimizer plugin for WordPress users, NameHero’s Imunify360 provides a broader range of protection against various cyber threats such as DDoS attacks and malware, covering all hosting servers comprehensively.

Access Control and Protection: NameHero stands out with features like Hotlink Protection and IP Blocker, which add layers of defense against unauthorized access and resource misuse, features that are crucial for maintaining website integrity and performance.

Conclusion

NameHero emerges as the preferred choice for security-conscious users due to its comprehensive suite of protective measures including robust firewall solutions, free SSL certificates, and advanced access controls. The integration of Imunify360 ensures proactive defense against a wide range of cyber threats, making it a reliable option for hosting environments that prioritize security without compromising performance or accessibility.

Customer Support: NameHero vs. SiteGround

NameHero:

NameHero offers comprehensive 24/7 customer support through live chat, email tickets, and an extensive knowledge base.

Live Chat Support: NameHero’s live chat support is exceptionally quick and helpful. Initially, their chat bot assists with queries, but you can easily switch to talking to a real person. During my interactions, I received replies in under 2 minutes, demonstrating their efficiency in resolving issues promptly.

Email Support: Their email support is also commendable, providing timely responses that effectively address more complex inquiries or issues.

Knowledge Base: What sets NameHero apart is their detailed knowledge base. It contains numerous articles with thorough explanations, making it easy for users to find solutions independently. I found that most of my queries could be resolved directly through their knowledge base, showcasing its usefulness.

SiteGround:

SiteGround offers support via phone, live chat, ticket system, an AI search tool, and a knowledge base.

Phone Support: SiteGround’s phone support includes features like estimated wait times and reference numbers for efficient handling. Calls are handled professionally and quickly, making it convenient for users seeking immediate assistance.

Live Chat Support: Their live chat support is described as helpful, friendly, and efficient, providing prompt resolutions to issues during various times of the day.

Knowledge Base: SiteGround’s knowledge base is extensive, featuring video tutorials and informative articles that help users understand and utilize features like the SG Speed Optimizer plugin effectively.

Comparison and Conclusion:

While both NameHero and SiteGround offer robust support options, NameHero edges ahead in several key aspects:

Speed and Efficiency: NameHero’s live chat support stands out for its quick response times and effective problem-solving capabilities. This ensures that users get timely assistance without prolonged waits.

Ease of Use: NameHero’s straightforward approach to customer support, including a user-friendly knowledge base, allows users to resolve issues independently, minimizing dependency on support channels.

Overall Experience: Based on personal experience and user-friendly interfaces, NameHero provides a more streamlined support experience compared to SiteGround’s somewhat cumbersome system, which involves navigating through multiple steps before reaching direct support options.

In conclusion, for users seeking prompt, efficient, and user-friendly customer support, NameHero emerges as the preferred choice over SiteGround. Their commitment to rapid response times, helpful assistance, and accessible knowledge base make them a standout option in the web hosting industry.

Winner –

Siteground vs namehero – Users review

The WP Speed Matters Facebook Group provides a fair platform for unbiased feedback. Some other groups are influenced by SiteGround’s team, who use their positions to favor their company, remove negative comments, and even ban critics. Here’s a comparison between SiteGround and NameHero based on recent conversations. Over time, feedback for SiteGround has declined, especially since 2019, while more users are opting for NameHero.

Server Caching: NameHero vs SiteGround

Server caching is a crucial feature for improving website performance, and both NameHero and SiteGround offer server-level caching solutions.

SiteGround provides a caching service called “SuperCacher,” which was initially limited to GrowBig and GoGeek plans but has since been expanded to the StartUp plan after recent price adjustments. While both hosts require you to install a plugin like W3 Total Cache or WP Rocket Cache for platforms like WordPress, the actual caching work is handled by the server.

NameHero, on the other hand, offers server-level caching out of the box due to its utilization of LiteSpeed. This means you don’t need to install additional plugins for caching, which can slow down your site. Additionally, NameHero has integrated with QUIC.cloud, a feature similar to Cloudflare but with the added capability of caching entire websites, including static HTML content.

The integration with QUIC.cloud is a significant advantage for NameHero, as it enhances server caching and improves website performance even further. In contrast, SiteGround does not offer a similar feature.

Server Caching Ratings:

– NameHero: ★★★★★ (5/5)

– SiteGround: ★★★★☆ (4/5)

Winner: NameHero wins due to its integration with QUIC.cloud, providing an advanced caching solution that enhances website performance.

Winner –

Siteground vs Namehero: CDN

QUIC.cloud’s CDN, tailor-made for LiteSpeed, boasts over 70 Points of Presence (PoPs) even on its standard plan. With features like HTTP/3 support, DDoS protection, firewall, and robust image optimization tools, it’s a formidable option.

Comparing QUIC.cloud’s free and paid plans to SiteGround’s CDN reveals a stark contrast. SiteGround’s CDN offers only 14 PoPs and limited image optimizations, paling in comparison to QUIC.cloud’s comprehensive feature set. While both CDNs cache HTML for improved Time to First Byte (TTFB) globally, SiteGround’s dynamic caching feature is restricted to paid plans.

Overall, QUIC.cloud emerges as the superior CDN, offering a more robust set of features and wider coverage compared to SiteGround’s basic offering.

Center Locations: SiteGround vs NameHero

When it comes to data center locations, SiteGround takes the lead with its extensive presence, especially due to its Singapore data center. SiteGround currently operates in seven locations:

– Iowa, US

– Madrid, Spain

– London, UK

– Frankfurt, Germany

– Eemshaven, Netherlands

– Singapore

– Sydney, Australia

On the other hand, NameHero has data centers on two continents:

– Lansing, Michigan

– Phoenix, Arizona

– Amsterdam, EU

Although NameHero recently expanded its reach with a new data center in Europe, SiteGround’s broader global coverage gives it an edge. However, NameHero’s growth indicates potential for further expansion, possibly including an Asia-based data center in the future.

Data Center Ratings:

– SiteGround: ★★★★★ (5/5)

– NameHero: ★★★★☆ (4/5)

Winner: SiteGround, thanks to its presence in Asia, providing enhanced accessibility for users in the region.

NameHero JetBackup vs SiteGround Backups

The NameHero “Starter Cloud” plan offers more robust backup functionality compared to SiteGround’s StartUp plan. Unlike SiteGround, which limits snapshot capabilities to its GrowBig and GoGeek plans, NameHero allows all users to take snapshots of their entire website on demand.

Recently, Ryan Gray enhanced NameHero’s backup system by integrating JetBackup, automating the entire backup process. This improvement ensures backups are performed automatically without requiring manual requests. Additionally, NameHero stores backups offsite, a feature not explicitly highlighted on their website but confirmed by CEO Ryan Gray. This offsite storage in a separate data center mitigates risks similar to those experienced by A2 Hosting in 2019.

Moreover, NameHero offers integration with DropMySite for affordable third-party backup services, emphasizing flexibility and cost-effectiveness compared to alternatives like CodeGuard and Jetpack.

In terms of backup ratings, NameHero receives 4 out of 5 stars (★★★★☆) due to its daily and weekly restore options, while SiteGround, with its 30-day automatic backup retention and offsite storage, earns a perfect 5 out of 5 stars (★★★★★). Therefore, despite NameHero’s strengths in offsite storage and accessibility, SiteGround edges ahead due to its longer backup retention period and similar offsite backup practices.

Both NameHero and SiteGround provide free automated daily backups on all plans, ensuring worry-free hosting with easy restoration options.

NameHero offers free Staging on all plans, allowing users to test changes before deploying them live with a simple one-click process via Softaculous App Installer.

SiteGround offers a more advanced Staging feature with GIT integration but doesn’t include it in the StartUp plan.

FAQ: Namehero vs Siteground

What is the difference between SiteGround and NameHero?

When comparing SiteGround and NameHero, it’s clear that NameHero’s plans stand out with more competitive pricing and valuable features. Their starter plans begin at a lower price point and include significant advantages like unlimited NVMe storage, making them a compelling choice for many users.

Is NameHero better than SiteGround?

NameHero’s speed, servers, support, and pricing are arguably better than SiteGround. Even though SiteGround is more popular, that doesn’t mean they’re the better choice.

2. Which is faster – NameHero or SiteGround?

NameHero uses LiteSpeed which is faster than Nginx (what SiteGround uses). LiteSpeed Cache is also faster than SiteGround Optimizer, and QUIC.cloud is faster than SiteGround’s CDN with more PoPs and full page caching. NameHero uses NVMe SSDs on higher plans while SiteGround doesn’t. Just based on specs alone, NameHero is faster than SiteGround.

3. Is NameHero or SiteGround better for WordPress?

NameHero is a good choice if you want cPanel, cheaper prices, and the option to use LiteSpeed Cache + QUIC.cloud CDN. SiteGround says they’ve crafted their service and Site Tools dashboard for WordPress, but that doesn’t mean they’re better.
